instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Purchased this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a broken screen The crack is minor seems like i should still get an image, back light does turn on.
I disconnected the internal display and tried with an external display but cant get an image .
I have tested this setup with a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and the external display will work with that.
Any suggestions to check if this is a bad Display or Logic board problem? i do not have another display to test with unfortunately.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Did you look at logic board, no liquid sign?
Possible cracked traces, if machine was dropped.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: No signs of liquid damage. No signs of a drop looks like the crack was from something hitting the lcd its self. Not even a scratch on the body.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Backlight presence should mean board is booting, but is better to confirm USB activity.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Caps lock key lights up , track pad is activated and usb activity confirmed .

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Crack is minor , usually I see a lot more cracks to not see an image.
cant explain why no external video though maybe it does not like my external display

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Try another HDMI adapter.
Best way to test with known good working compatible LCD assembly.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Yeah will have to wait until i find one. Have you replaced many of these displays, is there any issue with the T2 chip?

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
I never replaced one.
As I understood, no T2 issue...

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Just an update, As i thought it didnt like my old monitor its weird though because it works with a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Purchased a newer USB C monitor and it is now displaying an image with that.

threads.title: 2018 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Is time to test with 100% compatible LCD assembly...
